Entries.EastScarpe.1: Residence of Dr. Jacob Trenton, DVM.
Entries.EastScarpe.2: "Dearest Delilah, taken too soon, forever in our hearts." It looks well tended.
Entries.EastScarpe.3: A strange and unpleasant smell wafts out from the depths: a mixture of shadows, smoke and something deeper, something darker. You decide it's safest not to venture further
Entries.EastScarpe.4: Yuck! It's half full of bits of fish and a disgusting oozy liquid.
Entries.EastScarpe.5: It's an older boat, but very well cared for. There are fish heads in the bottom.
Entries.EastScarpe.6: This looks exactly like the sort of bridge a troll might live under.
Entries.EastScarpe.7: You cast your eyes out across the shimmering waters, somewhere out there are the Fern Islands. Perhaps one day you'll get to visit them.
Entries.EastScarpe.8: A tabby cat glares at you. She looks frightened. Better leave her alone.
Entries.EastScarpe.9: You push open the door and peer in. There's nothing inside except a chair, a tattered notebook and a pair of binoculars. There's a long narrow opening facing out into the forest.
Entries.EastScarpe.10: It's an old silo, converted into a house. Who could live here? Sadly, the door is locked.
Entries.EastScarpe.11: The writing is worn and hard to read, you can just make out, 'Cher   Orc   '.
Entries.EastScarpe.12: The rope looks a bit frayed. It might not hold your weight.
Entries.EastScarpe.13: A strange fishy aroma wafts up from the depths.
Entries.EastScarpe.14: East Scarpe Swimming Beach^^* Enter the water between the posts only.^* Swimming at your own risk.^* No lifeguard on duty.^* No changing room facilities, but you can use this rock (or just enter the water).
Entries.EloiseFall.1: Eloise's Diary: "I love fall! It's so pretty."
Entries.EloiseFall.2: "I saw a toucan! He cracked pinenuts with his big beak! I wish I had a proper camera."
Entries.EloiseFall.3: Between 'Birds of the Ferngill Republic' and 'Our feathered friends', you find a battered paperback.
Entries.EloiseWinter.1: Eloise's Diary: "Winter is cold! I hope Sora is keeping warm. I should send him something for Winter Star, but they don't celebrate it in GR."
Entries.EloiseWinter.2: "The cardinals are very noisy! They travel in big flocks. I saw heaps on the beach yesterday!
Entries.EloiseWinter.3: Mostly field guides to birds of the Ferngill region, and a battered book about a girl and a forgotten garden.
Entries.EloiseSpring.1: "I got a letter from Sora! He's fine but his family had to leave their home. He's staying with his aunt. I wish he could come stay with me. We've got heaps of space! And papa wouldn't mind."
Entries.EloiseSpring.2: "I love blue jays! They're so naughty! One stole Papa's sandwich right out of his hand!"
Entries.EloiseSpring.3: Mostly field guides to birds of the Ferngill region, and a battered book about a girl and a forgotten garden.
Entries.EloiseSummer.1: Eloise's Diary: " I wrote a letter to Sora. I hope he writes back soon!"
Entries.EloiseSummer.2: "No birds today :( I was hoping to see a woodpecker."
Entries.EloiseSummer.3: Mostly field guides to birds of the Ferngill region, and a battered book about a girl and a forgotten garden.
Entries.VetHouse.01: Sir Flufflekins the first wrinkles his nose and regards you suspiciously.
Entries.VetHouse.03: It's carefully written and addressed to someone in the Gotoro Republic. Eloise must write to a friend there.
Entries.VetHouse.04: A selection of beautifully illustrated books about the flora and fauna of Stardew Valley.
Entries.VetHouse.05: Looks like this chair's taken! Her Ladyship Princess Midnight the Third eyes you regally. You feel judged, and found wanting.
Entries.VetHouse.06: Tiny colorful fish. It's very clean, but perhaps a little small? The fish seem restless.
Entries.VetHouse.07: It's tuned to the natural history channel. There's a documentary playing on birds of the rainforest.
Entries.VetHouse.08: It's filled with women's clothing, all neatly folded and packed with tissue paper. Either Dr. Jacob has diverse tastes, or they belonged to his wife.
Entries.VetHouse.09: Very neatly organized, there's a full set of the Ferngill enclyopedias, plus textbooks on animal anatomy and behaviour.
Entries.VetHouse.10: Ah, here's where all the paperbacks are hiding: From thrillers, to horror, historic fiction and even a couple of romances; it's an eclectic range.
Entries.VetHouse.11: Eloise's taste range from animal stories to tales of children solving mysteries. They're in surprisingly good condition.
Entries.VetHouse.12: 'The Mona Lisa Smile': obviously Dr Jacob indulges in fast-paced crime thrillers.
Entries.VetHouse.13: The plants all look well cared for. And what was that skittering across the soil, a lizard?
Entries.VetHouse.14: A large raccoon studies you warily. Its ears are tattered, like it's been in a fight with something.
Entries.VetHouse.15: The screensaver shows a dark-haired woman and a toddler with pigtails. His wife and Eloise, you assume.
Entries.VetHouse.16: Dr. Jacob's workbook:^There has been an increase in small animals brought in with contusions and crushed bones, suggesting the presence of predators in the area.
Entries.VetHouse.17: A young woman smiles at the camera. You can see the resemblance between her and Eloise.
Entries.JacobBarn.1: Lady Snowflake nuzzles your hand. She's looking for treats.
Entries.JacobBarn.2: His Lordship Lord Sherbert seems well fed. He enjoys having his head scratched.
Entries.JacobBarn.3: Baron Reginald appears content in his retirement.
Entries.JacobBarn.4: Quiet, soothing music is playing. It makes you feel a little sleepy.
Entries.JacobBarn.5: Something is rustling inside the box. What could it be?
Entries.JacobBarn.6: It leads up into a hayloft. Looks a bit ricketty.
Entries.DeepDark.0: The chest contains neatly folded children's clothing and an array of toys and books, all placed with loving care.
Entries.DeepDark.2: The ladder looks worn, the wood gouged with claw marks.
Entries.DeepDark.3: This garden bed looks well tended, as though someone takes great pride in attending to it.
Entries.DeepDark.4: A battered journal. The writing within is sloppy and almost impossible to read.
Entries.ESOrchard.0: Beyond the barrels you can see a path leading off somewhere. But you can't get past them. Yet.
Entries.ESOrchard.1: Looks like a storm washed it out - or perhaps torn away. Perhaps it could be repaired again?
Entries.ESOrchard.2: The writing is worn by weather and age: "Che ry Or ha d" It's been scrawled over with the words "BEWARE!"
Entries.ESOrchard.3: Don't look too close! These plates have been here for so long the food remnants have practically fossilized.
Entries.ESOrchard.4: You can hear something scratching behind the door. It sounds much larger than a rat.
Entries.ESOrchard.6: That wasn't there before... Doesn't look very safe either!
Entries.SeaCave.01: A sweet, fruit aroma wafts out. It makes you think of home.
Entries.SeaCave.03: A sharp, bitter scent that makes your eyes water.
Entries.SeaCave.04: This vase looks very well crafted, although the glaze is slightly cracked.
Entries.SeaCave.05: A thick, smoky scent that catches in your throat, making you cought.
Entries.SeaCave.06: Finely made. Surely this belongs in a collection, not a sea cave!
Entries.SeaCave.07: These crystals seem a little tacky.
Entries.SeaCave.08: A thick, green gruel. Smells like kelp. The bowl is still slightly warm.
Entries.SeaCave.09: The label is water-marked and stained. But it seems to be about 20 years old, from Cherry Orchards.
Entries.SeaCave.13: The boards are rotted away. It must have been here for years, maybe even decades.
Entries.SeaCave.02: The battered and broken doll stares up at you with blank eyes. Wait, did one move?^Oh, there's a crab living in one socket. That's creepy!
Entries.ESInn.01: The magazine is read halfway through.
Entries.ESInn.02: The board is filled with reminders and ads. A little bit too many and definitely too messy.
Entries.ESInn.03: Notes and list of the inn guests. The different handwritings is rather disorienting to read.
Entries.ESInn.04: Boxes of fresh vegetables. You don't recognize whose produce it is however.
Entries.ESInn.05: *Sniff* The pastry has a very nice freshly baked smell to it.
Entries.ESInn.06: You wonder what's this piece of cloth doing here.
Entries.ESInn.07: Stack of reading material, mostly magazine and... Some other interesting selection.
Entries.ESInn.08: The wooden model is intricate and detailed. There's a little sailor standing in the ship deck.
Entries.ESInn.09: It seems healthy. Especially, for an indoor plant.
Entries.ESInn.10: The game pieces are abandoned in the middle of a game. What a tight match!
Entries.ESInn.11: Monday - Trout soup^Tuesday - Crispy bass and cookies^...^This is a very neatly written menu.
Entries.ESInn.12: zzzz.... You hear a buzzing static noise.
Entries.ESInn.13: *sniff* it's a distinct aging-wood smell, or is it?
Entries.ESInn.15: Lonely Valley: A Travel guide.^Someone left their belongings here.
Entries.ESInn.16: The bear is smiling toward you. Yes, you!
Entries.ESInn.17: The plant is thriving despite living indoor.
Entries.ESInn.18: An empty drawer, except for the inn coupons. Each comes with two very distinct signatures.
Entries.ESInn.19: The utensils seems to wear out from tons of usage.
Entries.ESInn.20: The television set seems to be rarely used. It's in a very good condition.
Entries.InnBath.01: Beads of condensation formed on the fake plant leaves.
Entries.InnBath.02: The shower area has a hint of pine aroma.
Entries.InnBath.03: The sink is unexpectedly clean for a public toilet.
Entries.InnBath.05: Refreshing floral fragrance is coming out of the locker. What's being kept inside?
Entries.HartResidence.02: "Advanced Guide on Design - by Perona. G."
Entries.HartResidence.03: Custom-made cup with Laura's name printed on it.
Entries.HartResidence.04: The bunny is not too dusty.
Entries.HartResidence.05: "Sometimes I am not sure what am doing. I mean, I'm a good son, a good brother, and a good person, right? I do what I love and do what other expect of me... Yikes, what am I thinking? I just have to keep doing better!"
Entries.HartResidence.06: A stack of children books. Some are in surprisingly good condition.
Entries.HartResidence.07: The laptop is not password protected. Hmmm, just all the expected things.
Entries.HartResidence.08: - Edit project Coconut^- Review project Turnip^- Draft Garsnip proposal^- Check reviews and respond to messages^...^the list keeps going on.
Entries.HartResidence.09: The metal surface felt cold when touched.
Entries.HartResidence.10: A huge selection of autobiographies, non-fictions, and romance. Also some books on family business and hospitality tucked underneath.
Entries.HartResidence.11: Umm, this must be Miguel and Eredith's private stuffs. Better keep them on their place.
Entries.HartResidence.12: A well-organized drawer. The clothes are folded and tucked in a very efficient way.
Entries.HartResidence.13: You found an old photo album. There's a photo Miguel carrying Laura on his back while Eredith holding the baby Stefan. Somehow it feels "blue".
Entries.HartResidence.16: One of many that are laying around.
Entries.HartResidence.18: It's a wide collection of video games. Laura sticks some notes on them. Seems like she's using them as source of inspiration.
